abstract.p: Shirley Thomas letter on Lynne Sharon Schwartz's June 4 Lives essay wishes she had Schwartz's courage to delete solitaire and other computer games0

block.p: I wish I had the guts that Lynne Sharon Schwartz (Lives, June 4) showed by deleting computer solitaire permanently. I vow every day that I will not play computer games so that I, too, can finish my writing projects. Yet the lure is powerful. Besides solitaire, I am hooked on playing ''Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?'' online. Since I'm incapable of wiping out computer games, there is only one solution. I must destroy my computer and write in longhand. I won't let technology ruin my life.
